arts.ttl: Referee forced to apologise to Hull City manager after Sunderland controversy
arts.sum: Sunderland ran out 1-0 winners over Hull City to move back to the top of the Championship, but their winning goal - scored by Wilson Isidor - came with a more than a hint of controversy

arts.ttl: Tim Walter reveals Bobby Madley chat after Hull City's controversial Sunderland loss
arts.sum: "Maybe you can interview the referee then it would be better," a frustrated Walter told Hull Live at the MKM Stadium. The hosts were furious with Madley for getting in the line of sight of Mehlem from a short corner routine, with the referee roundly booed by home supporters thereafter and when he blew the full-time whistle, and Walter says he felt the referee was ill-prepared, given how the Tigers build from their corners.

arts.ttl: Isidor's solo goal defeats Hull and sends Sunderland back to the top
arts.sum: Sunderland returned to the top of the Sky Bet Championship after Wilson Isidor's third goal in four matches sealed a hard-fought 1-0 win at Hull.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Sunderland as Charlie Hughes impresses on full debut
arts.sum: The Tigers, despite a bright start to the second half, with Chris Bedia hitting the bar, found themselves a goal down 25 minutes from time when their corner, yet again, ended up in the back of their net. On his City debut, won a decent 50/50 in the opening minute to help settle but near the end of the half, threw his arms up in frustration after Bedia lost the ball, and didn't close Bellingham down who shot just wide.

arts.ttl: Sunderland lead the Championship again as Wilson Isidor’s solo goal sinks Hull
arts.sum: The Black Cats won for the seventh time in 10 matches.

arts.ttl: Controversial goal seals Hull City's fate against in-form Sunderland
arts.sum: The hosts came close to breaking the deadlock early in the second period when Chris Bedia crashed an effort off the Black Cats bar before it fell away to safety, but it was the visitors who took the lead 25 minutes from time when Wilson Isidor raced away to beat Ivor Pandur, but the goal was controversial as the Tigers felt referee Bobby Madley had got in the way of a short corner routine at the other end when Marvin Mehlem had his pocket picked. Boss Tim Walter made four changes to the side beaten at Norwich City last time out, handing a full debut to Charlie Hughes who came in for Sean McLoughlin, while Gustavo Puerta was named in the starting XI at the expense of Oscar Zambrano, and there were returns for Xavier Simons and Abu Kamara.

arts.ttl: Hull City vs Sunderland LIVE match updates and analysis from the MKM Stadium
arts.sum: Hull City will be aiming to return to winning ways this afternoon when they host in-form Sunderland at the MKM Stadium in their first outing after the latest international break. The Tigers were 4-1 winners against Cardiff City in their last home outing when the club celebrated it's 120th birthday in some style, and they'll be hoping for a repeat against the Black Cats.

arts.ttl: Hull City dealt injury blow regarding Brighton and Hove Albion loan man
arts.sum: Hull City goalkeeper Carl Rushworth could face up to 10 weeks on the sidelines after sustaining an ankle… The post Hull City dealt injury blow regarding Brighton and Hove Albion loan man appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Hull City man details his MKM Stadium 'frustration' amid transfer point
arts.sum: City boss Tim Walter opted to start with Ryan Giles and in recent weeks and has deployed Cody Drameh on the left side of the back four as he continues to search for the winning formula in his starting XI. The left-back did play in the 2-0 win over Alanyaspor in Antalya as City rounded off their week-long warm weather training camp.

arts.ttl: Hull City have golden chance to prove doubters wrong against Sunderland
arts.sum: Former EFL striker Sam Parkin believes Hull City will suffer successive defeats when they host Sunderland at the MKM Stadium this afternoon, though he has offered some encouragement to Tigers fans. “I just can’t, at the moment, back against Sunderland and go for Hull, given what I saw last time out (City's loss at Norwich)," Parkin told the Championship Check-In podcast .
